text:
The other solutions to this involve using the form API to change the redirect on submit, allowing you to pass a query parameter to the thank you page.

You could also use a cookie. Just don't store sensitive info. Or if you have to make it expire fast
I prefer the query string modification if you absolutely need to pass specific information. Otherwise I’ve done the time-out hack as well
<@U7QHZR9DZ> yeah it's not great but I've used a similar thing on the thank you page:
then you can style the loader
Done all of this and even did one where I check for the contact property on the confirmation page, if it doesn't exist, delay a refresh
yea… wish there was a better way

I've used a confirmation page that redirects checks what page you came from and then sends you tot he proper one. It was like a middle ground that had a loading screen, please wait while we prepare this info.
Thanks for the confirmation :thumbsup: It's weird but it'll have to do.
